common_issues.title: PiecesOS and related components connection issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to PiecesOS from various components, including the Chrome plugin and CLI. Issues include plugin functionality errors, outdated plugin versions, and CLI's failure to retrieve context from LTM.  Further investigation is needed to pinpoint the root cause and provide solutions.  Check for compatibility issues between PiecesOS, plugins, and CLI versions. Ensure PiecesOS and related services are running correctly. Reinstalling components or clearing cache might resolve some issues.

related_issues.title: Failed to connect to PiecesOS
related_issues.text:
Failed to connect to PiecesOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

### Early Access Program

Chrome plugin doesn't work properly. I can't use the buttons and features, and the sidebar cannot establish connection either. Inside of Pieces desktop app it shows that the chrome plugin is outdated. However this is the newest I got from the chrome app store.

Plugin version: 4.0.9

common_issues.title: Chat bubble deletion breaks hover menu
common_issues.description: Deleting chat bubbles other than the latest one in a group causes the hover menu to only appear on the last bubble. This occurs on macOS and Windows Desktops.  The issue may be related to how bubbles are grouped after deletion. Ensure the hover menu functionality persists after deleting bubbles.

related_issues.title: Delete chat bubbles breaks the onhover chat menu's appearance
related_issues.text:
Delete chat bubbles breaks the onhover chat menu's appearance
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

This isn't a big one but looks like a minor UI regression. 

In a nutshell, deleting some part of the conversation then means you lose the ability to reach the hover menu on all chat bubbles.

If you delete any chat bubble other than the latest one of its kind ("assistant" or "user" kind) in a conversation then the remaining chat bubbles will get grouped, and you lose hover menu options on each-but-the-latest bubble in that group.


Steps:

- Open or start a conversation that has a long enough chain of prompts and responses
- Delete any chat bubble that is not the latest assistant or user bubble.
- Hover over the newly "grouped" bubbles and you should see the chat hover menu only appears appended to the latest bubble in that group

related_issues.title: bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
related_issues.text:
bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I just updated Pieces to try out L.T.M 2.5, and I noticed that the software keeps stopping and restarting on its own. I checked for any updates I may have missed, and none. I restarted the software by forcing it to quit, but the issue persisted. 

The issue only happens when I turn on L.T.M.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS and plugin connection and functionality issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with PiecesOS and its Chrome plugin. Problems include installation issues on Chromebooks with unresponsive buttons, plugin connection failures on Windows, and general functionality problems with the plugin and sidebar.  Further investigation is needed to identify the root cause and potential solutions across different operating systems and plugin versions.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and plugin connection failures
common_issues.description: Users report various connection issues across Pieces OS, VS Code plugin, and Chrome plugin on Windows and Linux.  Problems include "No available configurations for RGBA pixel format" error on Linux, general connection failures on Windows, and plugin version mismatches.  Suggested solutions include checking system compatibility (graphics drivers), ensuring Pieces OS and plugin versions are up-to-date, and reviewing logs for specific error messages.

related_issues.title: Starting error: No available configurations for the given RGBA pixel format
related_issues.text:
Starting error: No available configurations for the given RGBA pixel format
### Software

Pieces OS, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Whenever I am trying to start Pieces OS or Pieces For Developers via the Linux Terminal, or via VS Code Plug-In (I don't use / haven't tried other ways), the following error message appears:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3b7cc5de-7fdd-4a36-99f2-c806a7e540d6)

```
inxi -G
Graphics:
```

```
uname -a
Linux debian 6.1.0-25-amd64 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Debian 6.1.106-3 (2024-08-26) x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

Thanks in a advance!

common_issues.title: LTM Connectivity Issues in Pieces
common_issues.description: Users report the `ask_pieces_ltm` tool and other LTM features fail to retrieve context despite a functional LTM workstream.  Issues appear across macOS, Windows, and in CLI/Desktop app.  Troubleshooting steps include verifying MCP server connection, Pieces OS status, and LTM data collection.  Potential causes include authentication issues, data access layer bugs, or LTM initialization problems within the MCP server implementation.

related_issues.title: MCP `ask_pieces_ltm` tool consistently returns "Failed to extract context" despite functional LTM
related_issues.text:
MCP `ask_pieces_ltm` tool consistently returns "Failed to extract context" despite functional LTM
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS Sequoia 15.5

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

## Bug Report

**Environment:**
- OS: macOS Sequoia 15.5
- Pieces OS: 11.4.4 - Running (PID 699, actively collecting data)
- Pieces App: 4.1.4 - Active with functional LTM workstream
- MCP Server: Pieces MCP server on localhost:39300
- Test Client: Warp Terminal Agent Mode, Claude, direct curl testing

## Problem Description

The `ask_pieces_ltm` MCP tool consistently returns `"Failed to extract context"` with `"isError": true`, despite:

1. ✅ **LTM is working correctly** - User confirmed LTM is collecting data and showing results/summaries in the Pieces workstream
2. ✅ **MCP server communication works** - Can successfully call `create_pieces_memory` and list tools
3. ✅ **Pieces OS is running and active** - Process running with multiple active connections
4. ❌ **Only `ask_pieces_ltm` fails** - Every call to this specific tool fails

## Steps to Reproduce

### 1. Verify MCP Server is Running
```bash
lsof -i :39300
# Shows Pieces OS listening on port 39300 with multiple established connections
```

### 2. Confirm Tools are Available
```bash
curl -N http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse \
  -H 'Accept: text/event-stream' &
curl -X POST http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/messages \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"method":"tools/list"}'
```

**Result:** ✅ Successfully returns tools list with `ask_pieces_ltm` tool schema

### 3. Test create_pieces_memory (Working)
```bash
curl -X POST http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/messages \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "jsonrpc":"2.0","id":2,"method":"tools/call",
    "params":{
      "name":"create_pieces_memory",
      "arguments":{
        "summary":"Test memory",
        "summary_description":"Testing connection"
      }
    }
  }'
```

**Result:** ✅ `"Long term memory successfully created"`

### 4. Test ask_pieces_ltm (Failing)
```bash
curl -X POST http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/messages \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "jsonrpc":"2.0","id":3,"method":"tools/call",
    "params":{
      "name":"ask_pieces_ltm",
      "arguments":{
        "question":"What did I work on today?",
        "chat_llm":"claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022"
      }
    }
  }'
```

**Result:** ❌ `{"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Failed to extract context"}],"isError":true}`

## Attempted Variations (All Failed)

### Minimal Parameters
```json
{
  "question": "hello",
  "chat_llm": "claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022"
}
```

### With Application Sources
```json
{
  "question": "What terminal commands have I run recently?",
  "chat_llm": "claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022",
  "application_sources": ["Warp"],
  "connected_client": "Warp"
}
```

### Comprehensive Parameters
```json
{
  "question": "What did I work on today?",
  "chat_llm": "claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022",
  "connected_client": "Warp",
  "application_sources": ["Warp", "Google Chrome"],
  "topics": ["terminal", "commands", "recent"],
  "related_questions": ["What was I working on?", "What debugging was I doing?"]
}
```

### Different Application Sources Tested
- `["Warp"]`
- `["Google Chrome", "Safari", "Obsidian"]`
- `["Claude"]`
- Multiple combinations from the schema list

**All variations return the same error.**

## Troubleshooting Attempted

1. ✅ **Restarted Pieces MCP server** - Issue persists
2. ✅ **Verified Pieces OS permissions** - Has necessary macOS permissions
3. ✅ **Confirmed LTM data collection** - User sees active workstream data
4. ✅ **Tested different MCP clients** - Same error in Warp Agent Mode, Claude, and direct curl
5. ✅ **Used proper SSE endpoint** - `/sse` for responses, `/messages` for requests
6. ✅ **Verified JSON-RPC format** - Matches working `create_pieces_memory` calls

## Expected Behavior

The `ask_pieces_ltm` tool should return contextual information from the user's LTM data, similar to how the main Pieces application shows workstream summaries and context.

## Actual Behavior

Every call to `ask_pieces_ltm` returns:
```json
{
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "Failed to extract context"
    }
  ],
  "isError": true
}
```

## Analysis

This appears to be an **MCP server implementation issue** where:

1. The `ask_pieces_ltm` tool is properly registered and callable
2. The MCP communication protocol works correctly
3. The underlying LTM system has data and functions properly
4. There's a disconnect between the MCP tool implementation and the LTM data access layer

## Potential Root Causes

1. **Authentication/Session Issue**: MCP server process may lack proper authentication to access LTM data
2. **Data Access Layer Bug**: `ask_pieces_ltm` implementation may be using incorrect API calls to access LTM
3. **Permissions Issue**: MCP server may not have the same data access permissions as the main Pieces application
4. **Initialization Problem**: LTM access for MCP tools may require additional setup or initialization

## Request

Please investigate the `ask_pieces_ltm` tool implementation in the Pieces MCP server to identify why it cannot access the same LTM data that is clearly available to the main Pieces application.

## Additional Context

- Issue occurs consistently across different MCP clients (Warp, Claude)
- `create_pieces_memory` works perfectly, confirming MCP communication
- LTM is actively collecting and displaying data in the main Pieces app
- No relevant error logs found in system logs or Pieces application logs
- Multiple parameter variations attempted with identical results
